sv:property.sv:value: San Francisco, CA and Amsterdam, the Netherlands – January 26, 2009 – Hippo, a leading vendor of open source Enterprise Content Management and Portal technology, has launched version 7.0 of its Content Management System, Hippo CMS.
Open source vendor Hippo launches Hippo CMS version 7 with new core technological features

Hippo CMS 7.0 is an enterprise-class open source software product designed forbusinesses that have a large quantity of files, documents and web content that needs to be captured, stored, preserved and delivered internally and externally.

Version 7.0 features a completely new technological core based on Apache Jackrabbit, introducing full JSR 170 compliancy. The GUI technology moved to Apache Wicket enabling a modern AJAX GUI with drag drop and auto-save functionality. Version 7.0 is highly extensible, allowing organizations to choose from a wide variety of plug-ins in order to address their precise needs for managing and utilizing their enterprise content. This flexible architecture also allows developers to easily add custom functionality if no suitable plug-in is available.

The Hippo architecture introduced in the previous version (6.0), with strong separation of concerns and its content driven repository, has been further improved, introducing a high performance faceted repository based on Apache Lucene and Apache Jackrabbit. The faceted repository introduces 'drop and start' dynamic categorization of content; allowing organizations to significantly speedup implementation resulting in a dramatically improved ROI compared to traditional CMS.

Key features of the current release include:

  • A faceted repository allowing users to label their content in multiple ways to make it easier to order, find and use
  • Java Content Repository (JSR-170) support to access content repositories in a standardized manner
  • Support for JavaServer Pages (JSP), JavaServer Faces (JSF), Cocoon, Portlets and easy template editing to make the software extensible for developers
  • Extensibility through plug-in architecture and configurations to allow users to extend and modify the CMS as their content management needs change
  • Node granularity, making data more manageable
  • Indexing external repositories making it easier for content to be pulled from various / incompatible sources and indexed centrally
  • More 'tools' in CMS: http://forge.onehippo.org/

Arjé Cahn, CTO of Hippo, said “Hippo CMS 7.0 is designed to help organizations that need to manage a lot of data. It provides them with an intuitive, flexible and enterprise-class content management system that will meet the unique contentmanagement needs of their business, with no data lock-in or excessive costs. The new product was designed with ease of implementation and extensibility in mind.”

In the coming months, Hippo will further expand on the new concept of secure facets based on this new repository; allowing for non-hierarchical security and knowledge-driven workflow. Hippo CMS 7.0 is open source software that is free to download at http://www.onehippo.org.
A quote from CMS Wire "Hippo is hip and is on our “vendors to watch” list.
Hippo named 'vendor to watch' by CMS Wire

Hippo, a vendor in open source Enterprise Content Management and Portal technology, has launched version 7.0 of its Content Management System.

In the new release, Hippo CMS boasts easier categorization of content “that is not found in other open source CMS product,” in addition to a completely revamped technology core based on Apache Jackrabbit.

The Apachean Jack-of-All-Rabbits devotion sounds quite familiar, doesn’t it?

Don’t Know Much About Hippo?

Well, you probably should. Hippo is hip and is on our “vendors to watch” list.

Hippo CMS is an enterprise-class open source software product designed for medium to large businesses that have a large quantity of files, documents and web content that needs to be captured, stored, preserved and delivered internally and externally.

Hippo’s European headquarters are in Amsterdam, Netherlands, with over 50 employees. There’s also the U.S. office in San Francisco, California. The company was founded in 1999 and today has a global base of over 150 customers. Hippo’s target markets usually education, publishing, manufacturing, financial services, and governmental agencies.

Test Broken Link: http://www.example.com/nonexisting.html

Tuesday November 18, 2008 Hippo held its first official partner event in the Amstel Intercontinental Hotel in Amsterdam. The massive turn out and enthusiastic response shows the rapidly growing popularity of Hippo.

The events key note speech by Jan Willem Broekema, former director of OSOSS, president of the Internet Society and management consultant at Het Expertise Centrum (HEC) showed the great importance the Dutch and European governments attach to open source. It became clear that there are enormous opportunities for our partners around open source in the Government sector.

In the subsequent presentations the Hippo business model and our view of the open source marketplace were addressed and the way we want to work with our partners in the future.
The main presentation was obviously the technology preview by Arjé Cahn showing the new and upcoming release 7 of Hippo CMS.

From the evaluation we learned that the event was highly appreciated by our partners and that there's certainly a keen interested in future events. The fact that our partners want to share their knowledge with each other is obviously something we encourage and fits in the open source mindset!
Leading open source Enterprise Content Management (ECM) and Portal software vendor makes Deloitte Technology Fast 50 list for second consecutive year
Hippo recognized by Deloitte as one of the fastest growing European technology companies

San Francisco, CA – October 14, 2008 – HIPPO, the leading developer of web-based, open source Enterprise Content Management (ECM) and Portal software based in San Francisco and Amsterdam, today announced that for the second year in a row it has been ranked in the Deloitte Technology Fast 50 as one of the fifty fastest growing technology companies in the Netherlands. Companies are selected for the Deloitte Technology Fast 50 based on a variety of criteria including developing their own technology and revenue growth over the past five years.

Hippo is committed to the open source software model and has helped define a number of open standards. Developers from all over the world are working together to improve HIPPO products. HIPPO is also heavily involved in the Apache Software Foundation with key people involved in various Apache projects. Because of the commitment of the community to building quality products, it has grown fast. According to Deloitte, Hippo has experienced revenue growth of approximately 865%, ranking it number twenty out of the fifty companies.

Tjeerd Brenninkmeijer, CEO of HIPPO, said: “I want to extend my thanks to the entire HIPPO community for embracing our technology in 2008. The community has created a product that is adaptable, modular and scalable to millions of documents of all types. Our products are continuing to gain traction in large enterprises across multiple verticals because of the tireless dedication of our community.”

“At the beginning of the year we entered the U.S. market and have exceeded our sales targets for this key area. Our support model with guaranteed support and legal indemnification has been well received in the U.S. market. All signals are that this growth will continue in 2009 as more and more American companies are seeing the tremendous ROI open source technology can bring to their business. With our U.S. office now in full swing we are ready to meet this increase in demand for our products.”
Onsoranje.nl, the official website of the Dutch National soccer team has been launched based on Hippo Content Management System software.
JTeam and Hippo produce official KNVB Soccer website onsoranje.nl

JTeam a java based system integrator has in co-operation with Hippo, supplier of the open source CMS and Portal software with the same name, produced this official website of the KNVB (Royal Dutch Football Federation).

Onsoranje.nl is an initiative between Hacchette Fillipachi Media Nederland and the KNVB. This site is a showcase of Hachette's editorial strengths en creativity mixed with the football knowledge and inside information of the KNVB. Depending on the moment the portal publishes news when it is hot, background stories and analysis, offers listings of parties and events and, of course, in-depth news about the matches played by the Dutch national soccer team.

JTeam who was responsible for the technical realization choose Hippo CMS software for the technology. The main reasons behind this choice were the flexibility of Hippo CMS and the fact that Hippo CMS is based on open standards. This made it possible to build the site within a short time frame. The architecture of the Hippo CMS software allowed editors to create content whilst some of the front end functionalities still had to be implemented. In the course of the coming weeks during the European Championship Soccer for national teams in Austria and Swizerland the site will extend in functionalities.

Tjeerd Brenninkmeijer (CEO Hippo): the 100% open source CMS software of Hippo is known for its flexibility in managing and distributing great quantities of content from one location to multiple outlets likes website, intranet, e-mail, text message, print etcetera. One can adjust the layout of the website or any other media outlet at any given moment without this having any effect on the stored content.
Hippo, Dutch supplier of open source enterprise content management and portal-software has taken over all activities of the San Francisco based portal-specialist BlueSunrise.
Hippo takes over all activities of American open source company BlueSunrise

The deal adds the technical expertise of the BlueSunrise team to the successful open source business model of Hippo. BlueSunrise is particularly strong in portal technology, whereas Hippo is known for its content management software. With a presence in both Europe and the US, Hippo is rapidly becoming one of the world’s most important open source companies in the field of portals and content management.

Flying start

All the employees of BlueSunrise and the current management will join Hippo. Jeroen Verberg, financial director and co-founder of Hippo, "We have been looking at entering the US market for long time and with this deal we will hit the ground running. Beside the technical expertise of the team there, we will also have a number of interesting US customers."

David S. Taylor, director of BlueSunrise, "the deal with Hippo allows us to grow more rapidly and the Hippo CMS is a very welcome supplement in our product portfolio."

Integration

“It is nice that the technical integration is relatively simple, since the underlying technology of the portal software is the same. Some of our employees have been cooperating already for a few years within the Apache software foundation” said Verberg.

Dutch open source success

The deal follows a constant growth and success in the Netherlands over a number of years. Last year Hippo was the first and only open source company in the Deloitte Technology Fast 50, a list of the fifty fastest growing technology companies of the Netherlands. Hippo also placed 300th on the Deloitte European Fast 500, with a turnover increase of 517 percent over five years (2002-2006). Moreover, Hippo got a spot in the Emerce top 100 internet companies with the best reputation.
The Dutch capital is elected by the Apache Software Foundation to host this conference for three years in a row.
ApacheCon Europe in Amsterdam: an opportunity for the dutch open source-community

The Apache Software Foundation (ASF) again chooses Amsterdam as the location of its ApacheCon Europe. Arjé Cahn, CTO of hippo.nl - a dutch Open Source CMS and portal specialist - and member of the ASF, sees this a recognition of the important dutch involvement in the open source community.

The ApacheCon offers a look into the community that develops and shepherds industry-leading Open Source projects, including Apache HTTP Server – the world's most popular Web server software. Over 500 active users, developers and members of the Apache Software Foundation will debate all aspects of current and future Open Source developments. Attendants will be able to choose from all kinds of evens, from technical presentations and keynote addresses to Birds-of-a-Feather discussions and informal networking and social events.
More and more the dutch corporations, and especially the government, see Open Source as a better model for software-development. This makes Amsterdam a well suited location for a conference like ApacheCon. Last year the organization committed itself for three years to the dutch capital: with the government publicly revealing plans to use Open Source software, the organization decided Holland to be one of the best possible locations for such an event.

Hippo's CTO Arjé Cahn: “The fact that ApacheCon again takes place in Amsterdam should be seen as a compliment. At the same time it is an opportunity the dutch Open Source community should grab onto with both hands. It is an excellent possibility to exchange knowledge but also shake hands with people you've only met virtually.”

ApacheCon 2008 details:
ApacheCon Europe takes place 7-11 April at the Mövenpick Hotel Amsterdam City Centre, The Netherlands. Early Bird Registration and Conference Package incentives include savings up to EUR 500 through 7 February.

<

Hippo, the Dutch vendor of open source enterprise content management and portal software, has had an excellent year in 2007. This year was successful partly because more and more company's see the benefits of the usage of open standards and open source software. Also the Dutch government announced in September 2007 that government institutions must choose for open source software when possible.

Revenue
This year Hippo was the only open source vendor in the Deloitte Technology Fast 50, the fifty fastest growing technology company's in the Netherlands, with a total revenue of 517 per cent over five year (2002-2006). In 2007 Hippo realized the largest growth in its own history.

New partners and clients
Also Hippo has extended its client list considerably. The company made agreements for support contract for its open source enterprise content management and portal software with ABN AMRO, ANWB, SDU, ICTU, Incisive Media and the PVDA. Furthermore new partnerships were established with Lost Boys, IPROFS, Be Value, TDC lighthouse and HintTech.

Open Source Recognition
In 2007 Hippo received appreciation for the helped they gave with organizing and speaking at the ApacheCon Europe, the ApacheCon USA, the Apache Wicket meeting and the Cocoon GetTogether.

Arjé Cahn and Ate Douma where chosen as member of Apache Software Foundation. Hippo also played an active role with the specification of open standards (JSR 283, 286 & 301).

Moreover Hippo reached the Emerce 100 and the top ten in 'website management'. This list was based on research of TNS/NIPO.

Tjeerd Brenninkmeijer, CEO at Hippo: “This was a very successful year for Hippo. The market begins to see the advantages of open source software. We have made agreements with interesting company's and also the number of partners grew considerably. Furthermore interesting developments are taking place at international level. So Hippo looks forward to the upcoming year with a lot of enthusiasm.
Hippo, the Dutch vendor of open source enterprise content management and portal software belongs to the top 10 website management company's with the best image in the Netherlands.
Hippo is listed in the Emerce image top 10 website management

Hippo came in seventh in the category website management, which is part of the Emerce 100. This is an election of company's with the best image in e-business in the Netherlands. Hippo is the only vendor of open source enterprise content management software in the complete list.

The Emerce top 100 is put together with help by TNS/NIPO on bases of an inquiry among readers of Emerce, Computable, Management Team and Intermediar. Questions among others were how there was thought about over more than 300 company's in the field of knowledge, service, price ratio, and so on. The company's are divided in ten categories. Each category makes up its own top 10. All those ten best company's of each category qualifies for the Emerce 100.

Tjeerd Brenninkmeijer, CEO of Hippo: “Being part of the top 10 website management company's with the best image shows once again that open source is upcoming and its means further recognition for Hippo as being a leader in open source Content management. The recently by the Dutch parliament approved plan of Heemskerk with the aim to stimulate the usage of open standards and open source software by (semi) public government, will further improve this usage. For us so far it looks to be effective. With confidence we look forward to next year and we are striving for an even better qualification in 2008”.

Since 2007 national and international organizations are able to share and link information and knowledge effectively and efficient with the Hippo products. Hippo works with partners worldwide, which is one of the reasons for the successful usage of Hippo products by organization as ANWB, TUI Holland, VNU Business Media, Philips and ABN-Amro.

According to Hippo the open source model consist of two pillars: sharing and contributing. For years Hippo takes the opportunity in the month December to put these pillars in a broader perspective. This year we are focusing on children in developing country's.
Open Source is about Sharing and Contributing

Therefore Hippo supports the “One Laptop per Child” project and as you might understand our employees are very enthusiastic about the “Give One, Get One” action.

This OLPC laptop is designed for the poorest children in the most remote area's. The aim is to give these children an opportunity to discover, experiment and to be connected through internet with the world.
The foundation International Flower Bulb Centre (IBC) has chosen for the open source content management-software of Hippo for their new website.
International Flower Bulb Centre: “Search Engine Optimalisation is the most important factor in our choice for Hippo”

The IBC went looking for a content management system because they wanted to improve the exchange content between different systems for different target groups. An important reason for choosing Hippo was the find ability with the Hippo CMS in search engines. The CMS system of Hippo creates a so called ‘human readable URL’s’, with which you can see by looking at the URL which information the pages displays. This makes it easier for search engines to find the sites in their queries. Determining the choice for the product of Hippo finally was the price and quality ratio.

The renewed website is focusing on different target groups such as international consumers, flower producers, media, journalist and partner PR company’s. Also the site will contain partially static and flexible content. With this for example the diverse campagnes of the IBC will be visible on the website, as well as the permanent text with tips on how to breed flower bulbs.

In first instant the Hippo CMS will be implemented for the Dutch website. This site will function as the groundplan for the other fourteen sites for other country’s in which the IBC is active, amongst which the U.S., Germany, Japan, France, Italy, Scandinavia, China and the U.K. In a later phase of the implementation these other sites will also work with the Hippo CMS. In the future pictures, texts and video’s will be added to the site.

Wouter Pasman, Project Manager at Hippo: “we are glad with IBC’s choice for our CMS. For us it will be an interesting challenge to present the large amount of content for different target groups in an orderly fashion, but we will definitely be up to the challange.”

Lucas Boreel, Area Manager North-America, the United Kingdom, France, Italy and Holland of IBC: “We were very impressed by the structure and simplicity which the Hippo CMS has to offer, but also the price and quality ratio of the Hippo CMS was very appealing to us. We are convinced that our find ability in search engines and our internal and external information exchange will improve by our choice for Hippo.”
Hippo is very proud Gold Sponsor of the 2007 European Apache Conference in Amsterdam

Hippo develops and sponsors the Apache licensed Hippo CMS and Hippo Portal applications. We believe in the Apache way of developing, and actively participate in ASF projects. You can find our code in many projects, among which Apache Cocoon, Apache Jetspeed and Apache Slide.

We stimulate our developers to get involved in the foundation and become a committer in relevant projects, sharing our knowledge with others in true Apache spirit. Hippo is a member of the Java Community Process and helps define new Java specifications.

Hippo CMS is widely used in the Netherlands and across Europe, and is rolling out vastly to set a global standard in open source content management.

Read more at: www.hippo.nl/apache

Get involved in the Hippo community at http://www.hippocms.org.
Hippo partner Clockwork recently created a new website for the Dutch council of Justice based on Hippo CMS
Clockwork creates new presence Dutch Justice Council

Hippo partner Clockwork recently created a new website for the Dutch council of Justice based on Hippo CMS.

The new site addresses different target groups and makes extensive use of video. Furthermore a advanced self-help application was integrated.

http://www.rvr.org

Hippo, a Dutch supplier of open source content management software, collaborates with ITC service provider Levi9 Global Sourcing. The company provides extra resources from Serbia, that support the implementation of Hippo's open source software.
Hippo and Levi9 work together in Eastern Europe

Levi9, specialized in building, managing and testing IT applications, meanwhile has set up a large competence center of intensively trained developers in Serbia, that can implement the Hippo content management system (CMS). The Serbian developers are mainly used by implementation partners of Hippo. Because of the available resources in Serbia, partners can deliver a product with a good price/quality ratio.

The desire for a collaboration with Levi9 arose because the request for Hippo software kept increasing. Besides that, it becomes more and more difficult to find good high educated Hippo-developers. To concede to the implementation partners, Hippo has started 'nearshoring' through Levi9.

Tjeerd Brenninkmeijer, CEO of Hippo: " 'Nearshoring' has a number of advantages over 'offshoring'. Eastern Europe is relatively near to The Netherlands. The cultural differences are limited and we do not have to cope with a difference in time zone. Furthermore, it is still easily possible to exchange knowledge with the developers at their location. Levi9 has excellent knowledge of the Eastern European market. They select the developers and make sure that the required facilities for the developers are available overthere. We are extremely content about the added value that we can offer our partners and customers thanks to Levi9."

Bernhard van Oranje, CEO of Levi9: "We are happy that our Near Shore Delivery Services model, in which we combine the quality, reaction speed and flexibility of Dutch sevice providers with the reduction in costs of offshoring, works for Hippo. Thanks to our center in Serbia, we can provide Hippo with the well educated developers that they are looking for."
ITcommercie interviewed the specialist journal 'Autokompas' about the advantages of using Hippo CMS to realize a better ranking in external search engines.
Search engine friendly CMS generates more traffic on Autokompas.nl

The specialist journal 'Autokompas' exists nineteen years and aims at the complete car branche, ranging from garages and wholesale dealers to lease companies. The journal appears in print sixteen times a year with a circulation of twenty thousand. Online the editors publish faster thanks to a new Content Management System (CMS) and because of the search engine friendliness of this system the website is also visited more frequently.
Hippo, a Dutch supplier of open source contact management software, and Lost Boys have entered a partnership.
Press release: Partnership between Hippo and LBI's Lost Boys

The collaboration entails the addition of Hippo's open source content management system (CMS) to Lost Boys' portfolio. In the previous period, Hippo's product has been used on different projects and project managers at Lost Boys have been trained in using Hippo CMS. Hippo provides the support contracts and technical support, if needed.

Ewout Barendregt, CTO of Lost Boys: "We chose Hippo CMS because of the broad range of projects that Hippo CMS can be used for, and the usage of open standards and open source software. Because of this our developers can work with it quickly and we can deliver projects to our clients faster."

Jeroen Verberg, CFO of Hippo: "We are happy that Lost Boys chose our open source CMS system. We have been working together now for a while, and have carried out several projects in a successful way. We see this as an acknowledgment of the advantages of an open source CMS. We hope that with this official confirmation of our collaboration, many more projects will follow in the future."

Hippo Portal in use for personal information services for employees ROC Eindhoven has started using Hippo's open source portal and content management software. The education organization, for both secondary vocational education (MBO) and adult education, with over 22.500 participants and more than 1500 employees, uses the Contact Management System (CMS) to begin with for the intranet. In a later stage, also for the website the Hippo CMS will be used.

ROC Eindhoven was looking for a CMS to make internal information spread over the more than twenty schools and seventeen locations, available and comprehensible for all employees. ROC Eindhoven chose for Hippo's CMS after an extensive selection procedure. Crucial for the final choice where the price/quality ratio, the user-friendliness, the possibility to develop applications themselves as a ROC and the use of open standards. Since the data exchange takes place through the open XML-standard, news items for instance can easily be reused for various publication channels.

To begin with, the more than 1500 employees of ROC Eindhoven will start using the intranet, based on the Hippo CMS. In a later stage, also for the website the Hippo CMS will be used. Here information from one CMS will be reused for multiple channels. Through the intranet, employees can find information about the schools and services and about various running projects. Also, they can easily provide articles themselves for the intranet or look for the contact information or knowledge chart of colleagues in the 'smoelenboek'.

Hippo Portal
Besides the CMS, ROC Eindhoven also uses the Hippo Portal. The portal gives employees the opportunity to personalize their intranet and makes using the intranet more interactive. For instance they can save their favorites, the history is saved and people can choose which sources of information appear on their own startpage.

Harry Orbons of the IT-department of ROC Eindhoven: "Our organization exists out of twenty-three schools and seven services plus a Board of Directors. Therefore it was difficult to make all internal information that was present at the different parts of the organization, comprehensible for everybody. To make the information of the ROC easier to find and more accesible, we were looking for a good content management system for our intranet site. Finally, we chose Hippo CMS. The most important reason for this choice, were the attractive price/quality ratio and the use of open source and open standards. Althought the implementation was a lengthy process and didn't always go as smoothly, since the intranet site is being used, we now already had a lot of positive reactions about the user-friendliness and the comprehensibility of the information."

Tjeerd Brenninkmeijer, CEO of Hippo: "The challenge was to present the large amount of information that is present within ROC Eindhoven, in a way that is synoptic for the user. Now the possibilities to personalize ensure that users don't get lost in the abundance of information."

Hippo, supplier of enterprise content management and portal software based on open source, has been nominated in the Deloitte Technology Fast 50, a selection of the fifty fastest growing technology companies in the Netherlands.
Hippo the only open source supplier in Deloitte Technology Fast 50

Hippo is the only open source supplier on the list of nominees. The selection for the Deloitte Technology Fast 50 is based on various criteria, which includes developing an own technology and the growth percentage in turnover during the past five years. The exact list position of Hippo will be determined at a later stage.

From the very beginning and throughout the years, Hippo has been building a cast-iron reputation within the open source community. Hippo has made open source software available to companies that set high requirements with regard to continuity and availability, by supplying support contracts.
In the year 2007, national and international organisations that use Hippo products are able to link and share information and knowledge efficiently and effectively. Hippo cooperates with national and international partners, which has resulted in Hippo products being successfully used in organisations such as the Ministry of Finance, TUI Nederland, VNU Business Media, Philips and ABN-Amro. Hippo employs in excess of 30 people.

Jeroen Verberg, Commercial Manager at Hippo: “This nomination is jointly thanks to an intensive cooperation with the developers in the Apache community and the dedicated efforts of all the Hippo personnel. This nomination shows that open source is growing. Our growth in turnover shows that open source can go hand in hand with a healthy commercial model.”

The new website is using the open source content management system Hippo CMS. This is in line with the desire of the Dutch government to migrate as much as possible to open source software and open standards by the end of 2006. The usage of open source and open standards raises the freedom of choice, cooperation and effectiveness of information systems.
The Dutch Ministery of Finance has launched it's new website at www.minfin.nl

The new website is using the open source content management system Hippo CMS. This is in line with the desire of the Dutch government to migrate as much as possible to open source software and open standards by the end of 2006. The usage of open source and open standards raises the freedom of choice, cooperation and effectiveness of information systems.

The new website contains about 25.000 pages, and has around 10.000 visitors each day. A popular part of the site is the weblog of the Minister of Finance, mr Gerrit Zalm, which receives around 5.000 visitors each day.

The municipal Schijndel laid eyes on an ambitious plan. In 2010, Schijndel wants to be a leading municipal on the scope of digital provision of services and interaction with their citizens. Choosing a content management platform is an important selection, since this will be determining regarding the prosperity of these plans. To realize their demanding plans, municipal Schijndel has chosen for the Hippo CMS
Hippo CMS has been chosen by the municipal Schijndel.

The municipal Schijndel laid eyes on an ambitious plan. In 2010, Schijndel wants to be a leading municipal on the scope of digital provision of services and interaction with their citizens. Choosing a content management platform is an important selection, since this will be determining regarding the prosperity of these plans. To realize their demanding plans, municipal Schijndel has chosen for the Hippo CMS.

ICT environments within the Netherlands are known for their large diversity on closed legacy systems. The closed nature of these systems make digital interaction with citizens harder.

The Dutch government is aware of these problems. That is why she started the program Open Source Software and Open Standards (OSSOS) in 2002. The purpose of this program is to stimulate open source packages. From 2006 on, Open Standards will become obligatory. The Open Standards, for a large part XML, can assure that also legacy applications can exchange data in the near future. A prerequisite for digital provision of services.

Within travelling branches, very valuable supplements have been encountered by combining different legacy travelling applications with the XML application framework Apache Cocoon (part of the Hippo CMS).

Hippo is the leading specialist regarding Apache Cocoon in the Netherlands, and has the only native XML package on the Dutch market.

Hippo is extending her provision of services to local authorities and diverse (semi)governments such as bodies of surveyors of the dikes, health and educational institutes. With Hippo CMS, municipal realizes digital provision of services on an effective, low cost, platform.

Links: http://www.xml.com/pub/a/2003/11/12/cocoon-eai.html
